headline: Bucks County to receive about $45M under global opioid settlement agreement
author: Jeff Werner
sentences: DOYLESTOWN >> Bucks County will be receiving about $45 million under a global opioid settlement agreement reached with the “big three” opioid distributors and an opioid manufacturer.
In order for the county to receive its full share, every municipality in the county with a population of 10,000 people or more had to agree to the settlement.
The announcement was made by Bucks County solicitor Joe Kahn at the Feb. 16 commissioners meeting.
